page.title: 10Coal Mining.
page.content: The year 1985 is a significant one for it will see the end of coal mining in the area.The pit at Pye Hill is to close as is the nearby mine at Moorgreen.Coal mining at Brinsley probably dates from the turn of the 19th Century when the completion of the canals opened up the markets for coal.In 1890 the Barber-Walker Co.bought Brinsley Coal mine and much of the land in the village.In 1918 the pit was joined to Pye Hill at Underwood so that coal could be brought out of either shaft.In 1930 it was also joined to Moorgreen workings but coal ceased to be brought up at Brinsley anymore,it being used to take down men and materials.The site was finally demolished in 1965 and the shafts capped.The headstocks are now in the National Mining Museum.A long history of coal mining now ends.
